commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code for retrieving task details
commitResults.messageBody:
Added describe() method which outputs whether the task is checked
and returns a string with the corresponding checkbox and task
name. Reduces amount of messy code in the main chat controller.

Added three types of tasks
1. ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it
2. Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/
   time
3. Events: tasks that start at a specific date/time and ends at a
   specific date/time
Add State enum to keep track of program state

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support to create and list new tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Allows the user to create new todos, deadlines and events.
Validates user input using regex and checks whether the / keyword
is present.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code readability for command and status handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Replaced if-else statements with switch-case statements.
Refactored command and status handling into methods using the
handleCommand<command> or handleStatus<status> rule.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update output message for list and add task
Fix regex pattern for command handling
commitResults.messageBody: Replace + with * to allow 1 character arguments

commitResults.messageTitle: Set testing javac output target to version 11

commitResults.messageBody: Added test case for basic task adding - todo, deadline, event

commitResults.messageTitle: Move main method to top of Duke class
commitResults.messageBody:
Improve logical flow of code by placing the main and processInput
method at the top of the Duke class

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve clarity of naming and variable type
commitResults.messageBody:
Named variables as constants as required. Added the private keyword
for variables which do not need public access. Renamed unclear
method names.

Added comments for unclear methods and restructured if-else
statements with ternary operators. Used line breaks to separate
chained methods.
